title: CIty of the Sun
content:
CITY OF THE SUN

A phrase in Isaiah 19:18 that many Bible scholars believe refers to Heliopolis, an ancient Egyptian city. Heliopolis means "City of the Sun" in Greek. The city was a major center for sun worship in ancient Egypt, which explains why it was called the "City of the Sun." Some Hebrew manuscripts read 'ir ha-heres ("City of Destruction") instead, possibly reflecting a scribal variation or intentional alteration.

See Heliopolis.
